name: NPR
text:
Here's a rundown of where President-elect Joe Biden stands on major foreign policy issues, including:

◾ Reconnecting with U.S. allies
◾ Rejoining Paris climate agreement, WHO
◾ Middle East wars
◾ Confronting China
◾ Taking on Russia
https://t.co/7IqQMBcjeo

name: NPR
text: RT @shannonpareil: new from @BobbyAllyn & me: why live video remains a big vector for misinformation & conspiracy theories about the election, despite the steps social media platforms are taking to crack down https://t.co/qLxc9otIhR

name: NPR
text:
Despite the pandemic — or maybe in some ways because of it — new businesses are starting at record rates. But that comes with some important asterisks. (@planetmoney)
https://t.co/Xf2cPqVCxO

name: NPR
text:
Secretary of State Mike Pompeo refused to acknowledge that Joe Biden won the election, claiming in a briefing Tuesday that "there will be a smooth transition to a second Trump administration."
https://t.co/Y6GNSKifT7

name: NPR
text: RT @BobbyAllyn: New: TikTok has just appealed to the DC Court of Appeals asking that a Thursday deadline for its parent company to fully divest itself of US operations be halted, saying was based on a “purported national security review” https://t.co/1QVZsWiJdWNew: TikTok has just appealed to the DC Court of Appeals asking that a Thursday deadline for its parent company to… https://t.co/4xEfYX2z1C

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Joe Biden called President Trump's refusal to concede the election "an embarrassment" but said it hasn't yet hindered his team's efforts in moving forward with the transition process.
https://t.co/Mq5VA39zn6

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Joe Biden says he has spoken with 6 world leaders. "I'm letting them know that America is back," he told reporters. "We're going to be back in the game."
https://t.co/TOEvuVD66B

name: NPR
text: Boots #2: The Lost Songs is a collection of 48 tunes recorded by Gillian Welch and David Rawlings during a single weekend, then stashed away in the proverbial shoebox. The pair decided to revisit these recordings while in quarantine. https://t.co/GVxvvyatnY

name: NPR
text: Author Katherine Standefer was uninsured and working as a hiking guide when diagnosed with a genetic heart condition. She chronicles her experience with an implanted heart device in Lightning Flowers. https://t.co/AvKBEkh6Vo

name: NPR
text:
Emily Harrington climbed her way into the history books last week, becoming the first woman to free-climb the Golden Gate route of Yosemite National Park's El Capitan in less than one day.
https://t.co/JuGcDxb9Le

name: NPR
text:
A grand jury declined to indict the Indianapolis police officer who shot and killed Dreasjon Reed after a high-speed car chase that was captured on Facebook Live, citing insufficient evidence.
https://t.co/nfTlghXwei

name: NPR
text:
Many videos with false claims about voter fraud and a "stolen" election are still up on YouTube. 

A spokesperson said such baseless allegations do not break the company's rules.
https://t.co/NOC9P7QBht

name: NPR
text: In "Wintering," Katherine May writes beautifully of her own recent bout with a personal winter, a period when she felt low and overwhelmed, out of sorts and "out of sync with everyday life." https://t.co/PoTO240RVK

name: NPR
text:
DNC Chair Tom Perez: "Defeating Trumpism is a longer-term challenge because Trumpism predates Trump. And I would argue that Trumpism and some of the underlying challenges there in no small measure may date back 400 years."
https://t.co/2Orkc8wEcC

name: NPR
text: Shirley Collins is a legend — a humble one, but undoubtedly a transformative voice in traditional folk music. It's truly a miracle to hear her voice at this Tiny Desk (home) concert. https://t.co/ZotuEHVMtn

name: NPR
text: The Icelandic composer talks with All Songs Considered's Bob Boilen about finding rebirth through making music, the growing pains of turning 30 and how Death Cab For Cutie changed his life. https://t.co/WnZWWrXbkX

name: NPR
text:
Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and TikTok have stepped up efforts to curb the spread of misinformation about the election, but researchers say falsehoods thrive nearly unchecked on live videos.
https://t.co/pR6QRbUgNg

name: NPR
text: After fainting, Lucia woke up in the past. A new story about memory and identity on @radioambulante, our Spanish-language podcast. https://t.co/U2yKBDv9Qy

name: NPR
text:
Lucía abrió los ojos y no reconocía a su esposo ni a sus hijos ni su casa. Pronto se vio encerrada en una vida que para ella era completamente desconocida.

Escuchen su historia en @radioambulante, nuestro podcast en español. https://t.co/jHX9xy09hn

name: NPR
text:
A meat manufacturer is suing New Mexico after health officials ordered it to temporarily close, following six employees testing positive for the coronavirus in a five-day period.

The manufacturer argues the closure violates a Trump executive order.
https://t.co/1d8QdY3FRX

name: NPR
text:
After days out of view, President Trump is set to visit Arlington National Cemetery today to mark Veterans Day.
https://t.co/TZXLXFiEZK

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden is president-elect, and Democrats will control the House. But Republicans managed to outperform the polls in Senate races — and made gains down the ballot in the House.
https://t.co/OKAh2XcIh2

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: ELECTION UPDATE: President Trump has won the state of Alaska, according to a race call by the AP. https://t.co/HGHVvUHErm https://t.co/TvOoRNc0Tj

name: NPR
text:
After lashing Central America and the Florida Keys, Hurricane Eta is expected to make landfall north of Tampa on Thursday, bringing heavy rain and potentially dangerous storm surge.
https://t.co/1joNEINMrw

name: NPR
text: President Trump has won Alaska, per an AP race call. The state's 3 electoral votes for Trump come with little consequence at this point — the AP and other networks called the presidential race for Biden on Saturday. https://t.co/zqf5nPL4Pq

name: NPR
text:
Novavax released its $1.6 billion Operation Warp Speed contract in an SEC filing on Tuesday.

HHS — which told NPR in late August that it had "no records" of this contract in response to a public records request — has yet to release it.
https://t.co/8yMtyCQavY

name: NPR
text:
Republican Sen. Dan Sullivan has won re-election in Alaska, giving the GOP 50 seats in the Senate — and leaving the balance of power in the chamber to be decided in the pair of January run-off elections in Georgia.
https://t.co/izB0I412Pb

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRGoatsandSoda: In the study of more than 3,000 women across 20 sites in sub-Saharan Africa, the cabotegravir injections -- taken once every two months -- were found to be 9 times more effective than a daily pill of Truvada, the current form of PrEP. 

https://t.co/De4CQMiB8R

name: NPR
text:
President Trump made his first official public appearance since Election Day, attending a wreath-laying ceremony at Arlington National Cemetery. 

President-elect Joe Biden attended a separate ceremony in Philadelphia.
https://t.co/F4V2sMe0mJ

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: President-elect Biden has promised a broad expansion of K-12 to include 3- and 4-year-olds in the form of "high-quality, universal" prekindergarten. https://t.co/64EWqS41EZ

name: NPR
text:
A new monument on the National Mall is opening on Veterans Day: the National Native American Veterans Memorial.

“We wish for this to be a sacred place, not just for Native Americas, but for all Americans,” said Kevin Gover of the Smithsonian.
https://t.co/pUuqjIp6tW

name: NPR
text:
Since the firing of Defense Secretary Mark Esper, 3 other top Pentagon officials have been replaced by Trump loyalists.

"It is hard to overstate just how dangerous high-level turnover...is during a period of presidential transition," said Rep. Adam Smith. https://t.co/G79hPjN18x

name: NPR
text:
On Sunday night, Four Seasons Total Landscaping rolled out a line of T-shirts, hoodies and stickers, featuring slogans like "Lawn and Order."

On Monday, it started offering face masks, too.

By Tuesday, it was sold out.
https://t.co/YWGtxdBiYd

name: NPR
text:
Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and TikTok have stepped up efforts to curb the spread of misinformation about the U.S. election.

But researchers say false claims and conspiracy theories thrive nearly unchecked on live video streams.
https://t.co/VowI7UDimv

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRCodeSwitch: ⚡NEW EPISODE⚡

Throughout this presidential election, people have been trying to parse Kamala Harris' identity. So this week, we're talking about what exactly it means for her to be the U.S.' 1st Black-South-Asian-multiracial-female-vice-president-elect. https://t.co/6JOLjaJpuI

name: NPR
text:
Lucille Bridges — who braved death threats and racist slurs to escort her daughter to a formerly all-white school in 1960 — has died. She was 86.

"Our nation lost a Mother of the Civil Rights Movement today," said her daughter, Ruby Bridges.
https://t.co/C07LxOmLMM

name: NPR
text: RT @CPRNews: "These are public lands, right? We're all supposed to have access to them," Chavarriaga says. "And it doesn't really make sense for us to keep public lands a secret. That's an oxymoron. That doesn't make any sense at all." https://t.co/0GO7ZoKGVA via @maggiemlln

name: NPR
text: Arlington National Cemetery is planning to expand by 70 acres — about 50 football fields’ worth of space. @wamu885 https://t.co/HcPAlGchxB

name: NPR
text:
On Veterans Day, an NPR journalist shares how her father's reunion with his fellow soldiers in 2018 — on the 50th anniversary of the Battle of Ben Cui in Vietnam — was more than a reunion. It was a way to heal.
https://t.co/9BM6uMuPQC

name: NPR
text:
RT @GBH: On this day 400 years ago, 102 brave souls aboard the Mayflower first touched down on American soil in Provincetown Harbor (NOT Plymouth Rock) after a 66-day voyage from England. Then things got interesting. 

@bobWGBH tells the tale. https://t.co/HrsJqu1ckP

name: NPR
text:
Wearing a mask protects the wearer — not just other people — from the coronavirus, the CDC emphasized in an updated report issued Tuesday.
https://t.co/LK06NY5GNy
